title: South Ribble: £146 Million in Council Spending Analysed
summary: South Ribble Borough Council has spent £146 million across 16,065 transactions with 1,661 suppliers. Lancashire County Council is the dominant supplier at £18.4 million.
author: South Ribble Council Transparency

title: South Ribble: £395K in Likely Duplicate Payments
summary: Our analysis flagged £394,900 in likely duplicate payments across 104 groups — the third highest absolute amount of any Lancashire council we track.
author: South Ribble Council Transparency

title: Caddick Construction: South Ribble's £13.8 Million Building Partner
summary: Caddick Construction (NW) Ltd has received £13.8 million from South Ribble — the third largest supplier. What is the council building?
author: South Ribble Council Transparency

title: Crime in South Ribble: Ward-by-Ward Analysis
summary: South Ribble averages 810 crimes per month across 23 wards. Bamber Bridge East and Middleforth are the busiest areas, while Hoole and Longton remain among the quietest.
author: South Ribble Council Transparency

title: South Ribble vs Chorley: The Shared Services Partners Compared
summary: South Ribble and Chorley share a Chief Executive and back-office functions, but their spending profiles differ significantly. Here's how the partner councils compare.
author: South Ribble Council Transparency
